intro: Sisymbrium tucumanense var. rigidocarpum, commonly known as the rigid-seeded broomrape, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. It is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptation to harsh environments.
